Description: There's no available accessible parking space, you will have to find somewhere else to park.
The access aisle of the accessible parking is blocked, you will have to park somewhere else.
Your fuel tank is on empty, and you need to get gas, but there is no attendant available to help you.
It is raining outside, and you do not want to get out if your vehicle and into the pouring rain.
You really want to get an electric minivan, but the manufacturers can’t modify the van to make it accessible.
Your car has a flat tire, and you can’t change it by yourself.
Your modified van will be in the shop for a few days.
Your vehicle has broken down. You will have to wait for it to be fixed or get out.
Gas prices are rising for your accessible minivan.
Due to the inclement weather, you cannot drive on the roads.
Your shoulders are hurting, you'll have to stop and rest.
You've got pulled over and don't have your driver's license
Your wheelchair was damaged, and you can't use the docking system.
It is raining outside which makes it hard for you to drive. You pull over on the side of the road and decide to wait out the rain.
Your vehicle malfunctions and needs routine maintenance.
Your body is sore from doing too much physical activity yesterday, and you can't transfer.
You forgot to bring your driver's license with you.
Outcome: Go back to the starting point (no refunds!)

Description: Your vehicle is being modified to be wheelchair accessible and is running far behind schedule.
Due to the inclement weather, you cannot drive on the roads.
Due to the heavy rain, it is impossible to get to the bus station.
Because of negative public perception, you don't want to take bus right now.
Bus routes have changed due to local road construction, and the new bus stop is not accessible.
Bus routes have changed due to local road construction making your bus ride longer
The bus ramp has stopped working and you cannot get on or off the bus.
The bus has broken down. You will have to wait for it to be fixed or get off here.
The bus is stuck in traffic and running late.
The bus is crowded, and there are no wheelchair accessible space available.
You forgot your bus pass at home.
Outcome: Go back to the starting point

Description: Due to the bad weather, you cannot go anywhere!
The bus hits every red light.
You get on the wrong bus and only realize your mistake after the doors have closed.
The bus came early and you missed it.
Your employer no longer provides you with a free bus pass.
Your bus card is not working, and the bus driver kicks you off.
The bus came early and you missed it.
The bus driver is rude and seems annoyed at your disability.
The passengers stare at you and make you uncomfortable.
The bus fares have been raised.
Bus routes have changed due to local road construction, and the new bus stop is not accessible.
The driver is late for pick up.
The driver is stuck in traffic and the paratransit trip takes much longer than expected.
It is raining and you have to wait outside, which makes you wet and uncomfortable.
You are running behind schedule and skip some of your errands to be ready for the paratransit to come pick you up.
The driver is rude and provides assistance begrudgingly.
The city no longer subsidizes paratransit.
The paratransit is crowded, and you have to sit in the back which is the furthest from the heating/cooling vents.
The paratransit is running late. You will have to keep waiting or find another way.
Due to the bad weather, you cannot go anywhere!
Your wheelchair was damaged by the paratransit.
You are no longer eligible for paratransit.
The paratransit vehicle hits every red light.
You have a lot of things to carry and can’t get on the paratransit because you have exceeded the baggage limit.
Your paratransit breaks down and your pickup time is delayed.
The person sitting next to you is talking on speaker phone quite loudly which prevents you from resting on the ride.
The paratransit vehicle hits every red light.
The paratransit is runnint late. You will have to keep waiting or find another way.
Due to the extreme weather conditions, you need to slow down and find shelter immediately.
The sidewalk is blocked by construction.
The curb cut is blocked and not accessible.
There is no Sidewalk. You need to go back and find another way.
It just started to rain, and you must find shelter immediately.
Your arms are tired from using your wheelchair and you must rest.
Your wheelchair has a flat tire, and you must wait for help.
Your power wheelchair is on low battery, and you must find a place for it to charge immediately.
Outcome: Go back 3 spaces and skip your next turn
